com.google.code.p.gwtchismes.client
Class GWTCBox

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject
      com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget
          com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Panel
              com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.SimplePanel
                  com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.DecoratorPanel
                      com.google.code.p.gwtchismes.client.GWTCBox
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.google.gwt.user.client.EventListener, com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasWidgets, java.lang.Iterable<com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget>
public class GWTCBox
extends com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.DecoratorPanel

Panel decorated with rounded borders.

It uses a DockPanel inside a DecoratorPanel

Author:
Manuel Carrasco Mo√±ino

Example

        GWTCBox box = new GWTCBox(GWTCBox.StyleBlue);
        box.setTitle("A Title")
        box.setText("Sample text")
        box.add(new Label("label"), DockPanel.NORTH);
        RootPanel.get().add(box);

CSS Style Rules

  • .GWTCBox { default and main style }
  • .GWTCBox { blue box }
  • .GWTCBox { grey box }
  • .GWTCBox h3.title { title }
  • .GWTCBox p.text { text }
  • .GWTCBox .panel { content panel }

add

public void add(java.lang.Object object,
                com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.DockPanel.DockLayoutConstant direction)
Adds elements to the panel in the position specified, these elements can be Widgets, Elements and html Strings. Valid directions are DockPanel.NORTH DockPanel.SOUTH DockPanel.EAST DockPanel.WEST
